Package it.polimi.ingsw.ps19.view.gui

  • Class Summary 
    Class Description
    ActionPanel
    The panel that allows the construction of an action, letting the user choose between the family members and the servants he wants to use in the action.
    BoardPanel
    This JPanel extension is the left-side of the frame, the one containing the board image with all his components, at the moment of the creation the board image is scaled mantaining the proportions to adapt it to any kind of screen, components put into this BoardPanel must set the bounds for themselves and scale their dimensions to create a responsive UI.
    CardButton
    A development card button that positions itself on the board based on the parameters passed to the constructor.
    ChooseAction
    The panel that lets the user choose what he wants to do when it's his turn.
    ChooseExcommunicationPanel
    The Panel that lets the player choose if he wants to be excommunicated or support the church
    ChoosePrivilegePanel
    The Panel that lets the player choose the resources given by a council privilege
    CouncilButton
    The Class CouncilButton.
    DicePanel
    The Class DicePanel.
    EndOrDiscardPanel
    The panel that lets the user choose to discard a leader card or end his round when he's already performed an action.
    EventListener
    The listener interface for receiving event events.
    ExcommCube
    The Class ExcommCube.
    ExcommTileFirstPeriod
    The Class ExcommTileFirstPeriod.
    ExcommTileSecondPeriod
    The Class ExcommTileSecondPeriod.
    ExcommTileThirdPeriod
    The Class ExcommTileThirdPeriod.
    FaithPointMarkerDisk
    The Class FaithPointMarkerDisk.
    FamilyMemberPawn
    The Class FamilyMemberPawn.
    GamePanel
    The content of the entire frame (MyFrame) during the GamePlay.
    GraphicalUserInterface
    The GUI, implementations of the User Interface using Swing and AWT components
    InitialPanel
    The Initial image that the players see while waiting for the game to start
    JDevelopmentCard
    This class represents a general development card, it displays it and gives the functionalities offered by a JButton
    JLeaderCard
    This class represents a general leader card, it displays it and gives the functionalities offered by a JButton
    JResource
    A generic resource displaying image, name and amount.
    LeadersPanel
    The panel that shows the player his leader cards
    MarketButton
    The Class MarketButton.
    MilitaryPointMarkerDisk
    The Class MilitaryPointMarkerDisk.
    MultipleHarvestButton
    The Class MultipleHarvestButton.
    MultipleProductionButton
    The Class MultipleProductionButton.
    MyFrame
    This is the main frame of the game.
    OrderMarkerDisk
    The Class OrderMarkerDisk.
    PersonalBoard
    The player personal board, it extends JFrame, and it's the only "external" frame in the GUI
    PersonalBoardPanel
    The panel containing the image of the personal board of the player, it has the layout manager set to null so that components (Development Cards) can be scaled and positioned in the correct position based on the screen dimension
    PlayerResources
    The panel showing the resources of the player, note that the points aren't shown here because everyone can see them in the board panel
    ProductionChoices
    The panel that lets the user selects the different choices he has for the production action he intended to do
    RoundedBorder
    A rounded border used for market buttons and single production and harvest
    SingleHarvestButton
    The Class SingleHarvestButton.
    SingleProductionButton
    The Class SingleProductionButton.
    StrategyEditor
    This Panel is a simple text editor the player can use to write notes about the status of the other players that he's now allowed to freely see in our version of the game, this decision was made to make the game more challenging and to rewards the player who better use this feature and are constantly monitoring the actions of other players.
    VictoryPointMarkerDisk
    The Class VictoryPointMarkerDisk.
